item.title: 在 ISS 敦促股东拒绝马斯克薪酬方案后，特斯拉仍坚持马斯克的薪酬方案
item.description: 特斯拉周一为批准首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）560亿美元薪酬方案的提议进行了辩护，并表示新的薪酬方案成本会更高，几天前一家顶级代理咨询公司建议股东投票反对该提议。【原文：Tesla on Monday defended a proposal to ratify CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package and said a new compensation would be costlier, days after a top proxy advisory firm recommended shareholders to vote against the proposal.】

item.title: 精神航空任命布莱恩-麦克梅纳米为临时首席财务官
item.description: 精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）周一任命布莱恩-麦克梅纳米（Brian McMenamy）为临时首席财务官，自 6 月 14 日起生效。【原文：Spirit Airlines on Monday named Brian McMenamy as interim chief financial officer, effective June 14.】

item.title: 捷蓝航空预计第二季度收入将因健康的旅行需求而增加
item.description: 捷蓝航空公司（JetBlue Airways）周一预测，由于旅游需求健康，第二季度收入降幅将小于此前预测，这使其股价在盘前交易中上涨了 2.3%。【原文：JetBlue Airways on Monday forecast a smaller drop in second-quarter revenue than it had previously forecast due to healthy travel demand, sending its shares up 2.3% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 独家报道首席执行官称：Arm 的目标是在五年内占领 50% 的 PC 市场份额
item.description: 在微软及其硬件合作伙伴准备推出一批基于这家英国公司技术的新电脑之际，芯片设计公司Arm Holdings的首席执行官表示，Arm Holdings的目标是在五年内获得Windows PC市场50%以上的份额。【原文：Arm Holdings aims to gain more than 50% of the Windows PC market in five years, the chip designer's CEO said, as Microsoft and its hardware partners prepare to launch a new batch of computers based on the British firm's technology.】

item.title: 英伟达凭借人工智能驱动的涨势领跑五月全球市值涨幅榜
item.description: 英伟达（Nvidia）5 月份的市值涨幅居全球公司之首，因其丰厚的收入预期增强了投资者对人工智能推动的芯片需求激增的信心，从而带来了令人惊叹的涨势。【原文：Nvidia led global companies in market cap gains in May, buoyed by a stunning rally as its bumper revenue forecast reinforced investor confidence in the AI-driven surge in chip demand.】

item.title: 比尔-阿克曼的潘兴广场公司以 10.5 亿美元出售 10% 股份
item.description: 亿万富翁比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）的潘兴广场资本管理公司（Pershing Square Capital Management）周一表示，它已以 10.5 亿美元的价格向一个投资者财团出售了 10% 的股份。【原文：Billionaire Bill Ackman's Pershing Square Capital Management said on Monday it has sold a 10% stake for $1.05 billion to a consortium of investors.】

item.title: 墨西哥比索下跌近 3%，谢因鲍姆压倒性优势引发改革忧虑
item.description: 墨西哥比索兑美元汇率周一下跌近 3%，此前克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）在总统选举中取得压倒性胜利，执政联盟有望获得超级多数席位，市场担心这将带来宪法变革。【原文：Mexico's peso slipped nearly 3% against the dollar on Monday after Claudia Sheinbaum won a landslide victory in the presidential election and the ruling coalition looked poised for a super-majority that markets fear could bring constitutional change.】

item.title: 夏季交易开始，超级大盘股提振纳斯达克期货
item.description: 纳斯达克指数期货周一领涨华尔街，并将以积极的姿态开始 6 月份的第一个交易日，因为大型成长股上涨，在上周五收红后收复了一些失地。【原文：Nasdaq futures led Wall Street gains on Monday and were set to begin June's first trading day on a positive note as megacap growth stocks rose, recovering some ground after closing Friday's session in the red.】

item.title: Spotify 提高美国高级计划价格以增加利润
item.description: Spotify 周一提高了其在美国的高级计划价格，这是这家瑞典音乐流媒体服务公司为提高利润率而采取的最新举措。【原文：Spotify raised prices for its premium plans in the United States on Monday, the latest step by the Swedish music-streaming service in its push to increase margins.】

item.title: 独家报道特斯拉董事格比亚称曾与马斯克讨论卖房事宜
item.description: 特斯拉董事乔-格比亚（Joe Gebbia）退出了为这家汽车制造商的未来做出关键决策的董事会委员会，他告诉路透社，首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）曾讨论过从他的初创公司购买一套房子，他担心他们之间的友谊会被利用来攻击委员会的独立性。【原文：Joe Gebbia, the Tesla director who exited a board committee that made key decisions about the car maker's future, told Reuters that CEO Elon Musk had discussed purchasing a house from his start-up and that he was concerned their friendship could be seized on to attack the committee's independence.】

item.title: 美国 华尔街关注大选频发的六月和就业周
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 分析家观点 墨西哥总统谢因鲍姆在总统选举中取得压倒性胜利
item.description: 克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）以压倒性优势胜出，成为墨西哥第一位女总统，继承了她的导师、即将卸任的领导人安德烈斯-曼努埃尔-洛佩斯-奥夫拉多尔（Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador）的事业，后者在穷人中的声望帮助她取得了胜利。【原文：Claudia Sheinbaum has won a landslide victory to become Mexico's first female president, inheriting the project of her mentor and outgoing leader Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador whose popularity among the poor helped drive her triumph.】

item.title: 国际航空运输协会（IATA）称，航空公司的税收仍应由总部所在国负责
item.description: 国际航空运输协会（IATA）周一表示，联合国不应改变关于全球航空公司征税方式的公约，并警告说这样做将增加复杂性和成本，并可能导致航线被取消。【原文：The United Nations should not change a convention on how global airlines are taxed, the International Air Transport Association (IATA) said on Monday, cautioning that doing so would add complexity and cost, and might cause routes to be scrapped.】

item.title: 咆哮的凯蒂猫 "在 Reddit 上发布了 1.16 亿美元的赌注，GameStop 因此大涨
item.description: 2021 年零售交易狂潮背后的股票影响者 "咆哮的小鹰 "基思-吉尔（Keith Gill）在 Reddit 上发布了一个帖子，显示他在这家陷入困境的电子游戏零售商身上下了 1.16 亿美元的赌注，此后 GameStop 股价在周一盘前大涨超过 70%。【原文：GameStop shares surged more than 70% premarket on Monday after "Roaring Kitty" Keith Gill, the stocks influencer behind the 2021 retail trading frenzy, returned to Reddit with a post showing a $116 million bet on the embattled videogame retailer.】

item.title: 马士基在亚洲和地中海面临严重的港口拥堵问题
item.description: 丹麦航运集团马士基周一在一份声明中说，地中海和亚洲港口面临严重的码头拥堵问题，导致船期严重延误。【原文：Maersk faces significant terminal congestion in Mediterranean and Asian ports, causing substantial delays in its vessel schedule, the Danish shipping group said in a statement on Monday.】

item.title: 欧元区 5 月份制造业采购经理人指数显示潜在复苏迹象
item.description: 一项调查显示，欧元区制造业的长期低迷可能在上个月出现转机，该调查显示新订单的下降速度是两年来最慢的，从而使企业信心有所改善。【原文：The long-running downturn in euro zone manufacturing may have turned a corner last month, according to a survey which showed new orders declined at their slowest pace in two years, leading to improved business confidence.】

item.title: 爱立信称美国反腐败合规监控已结束
item.description: 瑞典爱立信公司周一表示，一项为期四年的监督该公司遵守美国反腐败协议的计划已于 6 月 2 日结束。【原文：Sweden's Ericsson said on Monday that a four-year programme to monitor the company's compliance with a U.S. anti-corruption agreement had ended on June 2.】

item.title: 国际航空运输协会（IATA）负责人表示，无需降低航空增长以实现净零增长
item.description: 全球航空机构国际航空运输协会（IATA）负责人表示，为了实现到 2050 年实现碳净零排放的行业目标，没有必要降低全球航空业的增长速度。【原文：The head of the global airline body IATA said there was no need to reduce growth in global aviation in order to meet an industry target to meet net zero carbon emissions by 2050.】

item.title: Blackstone 将 Hipgnosis 的报价提高了 1 美分
item.description: Blackstone 周一将其对 Hipgnosis Songs Fund 的报价提高了 1 美分，达到每股 1.31 美元，对这家拥有夏奇拉和 Red Hot Chili Peppers 等艺人的音乐版权所有者的估值为 15.8 亿美元。【原文：Blackstone on Monday raised its offer for Hipgnosis Songs Fund by a cent to $1.31 per share, valuing the music rights owner of artists such as Shakira and Red Hot Chili Peppers at $1.58 billion.】

item.title: 腾讯和腾讯音乐收购泰国 GMM 音乐公司股份，估值达 7 亿美元
item.description: 泰国娱乐平台 GMM Music 周一表示，腾讯和腾讯音乐娱乐将收购该公司 10% 的股份，估值达 7 亿美元。【原文：Thai entertainment platform GMM Music on Monday said Tencent and Tencent Music Entertainment will acquire a 10% stake in the company, valuing it at $700 million.】

item.title: 丰田及其他日本汽车制造商因汽车认证问题受到抨击
item.description: 丰田汽车公司周一表示，在日本交通部的推动下，公司董事长将就其对汽车认证申请进行的调查发表讲话。【原文：Toyota Motor said on Monday its chairman would speak about an investigation it has conducted into its vehicle certification applications after being prompted by Japan's transport ministry.】

item.title: 美国对英国科技公司创始人迈克-林奇的刑事审判即将结束
item.description: 英国科技先驱迈克-林奇（Mike Lynch）欺诈案的陪审员预计将于周一在旧金山听取结案陈词，该案与惠普公司 2011 年斥资 110 亿美元收购其软件公司 Autonomy 有关。【原文：Jurors at the trial of British tech pioneer Mike Lynch are expected to hear closing arguments in San Francisco on Monday in the fraud case related to Hewlett-Packard's $11 billion acquisition of his software company Autonomy in 2011.】

item.title: 卡塔尔航空公司正在洽谈空客和波音订单
item.description: 卡塔尔航空公司（Qatar Airways）首席执行官周一表示，该公司正在与飞机制造商空中客车公司（Airbus）和波音公司（Boeing）洽谈大型宽体客机订单。【原文：Qatar Airways is in talks with plane makers Airbus and Boeing for a major wide-body order, its chief executive said on Monday.】

item.title: 全球航空公司上调 2024 年利润展望
item.description: 全球航空公司周一上调了 2024 年的利润预期，并预计随着旅客登机人数创下新高，全行业收入将接近 1 万亿美元。【原文：Global airlines on Monday raised their profit forecast for 2024 and projected industry-wide revenues just shy of $1 trillion as a record number of travellers board flights.】

item.title: 聚焦：继中国之后，Zara 将现场购物实验扩展到欧洲和美国
item.description: 今年，Zara 将把购物直播扩展到英国、欧洲和美国，对这种在中国已经大受欢迎但西方购物者不太熟悉的形式进行测试。【原文：Zara will expand its live shopping broadcasts to the UK, Europe and the United States this year, testing a format that is already wildly popular in China but one with which Western shoppers are less familiar.】

item.title: 审判之后，大选在即，投资者权衡特朗普 2.0 因素
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）上周成为首位被判重罪的前总统，但华尔街认为他仍有很大机会在 11 月的大选中获胜，并正在研究这位共和党候选人的第二个任期会对市场产生怎样的影响。【原文：Donald Trump last week became the first former president convicted of a felony, but Wall Street believes he still has a solid chance of winning the November election and is gaming out how a second term for the Republican candidate could impact markets.】

item.title: Arm 预计到 2025 年底将有 1,000 亿台 Arm 设备为人工智能做好准备
item.description: 英国芯片设计公司Arm Holdings首席执行官雷内-哈斯（Rene Haas）周一在台北举行的Computex论坛上表示，预计到明年年底，全球将有1000亿台Arm设备为人工智能做好准备。【原文：British chip designer Arm Holdings expects 100 billion Arm devices worldwide will be ready for artificial intelligence by the end of next year, the company's chief executive, Rene Haas, said on Monday at the Computex forum in Taipei.】

item.title: 早间竞价：工厂嗡嗡作响，市场情绪高涨
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole.】

item.title: 据《金融时报》报道，Blackstone 将提高 Hipgnosis 的出价，作为修订后出价的一部分
item.description: 据《金融时报》周一报道，作为修订后出价的一部分，Blackstone 将把对 Hipgnosis Songs Fund 的出价从 1.30 美元提高 1 美分至 1.31 美元。【原文：Blackstone will sweeten its offer for Hipgnosis Songs Fund by a cent to $1.31 from $1.30 as part of a revised bid, the Financial Times reported on Monday.】

item.title: 全球需求强劲，5 月份亚洲工厂活动扩大
item.description: 周一的民间调查显示，由于制造商受益于全球需求的扩大，亚洲工厂活动在5月份有所扩大，这增加了该地区经济持续复苏的希望，而中国正显示出经济反弹的早期迹象。【原文：Asian factory activity expanded in May as manufacturers benefited from broadening global demand, private surveys showed on Monday, adding to hopes for sustained economic recovery in the region where China is showing early signs of rebound.】
